topic.name: General Linguistics Fundamentals
topic.sub_subject_name: Biblical Hebrew (Language of the Old Testament)
topic.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for General Linguistics Fundamentals in Classical & Foreign Languages

objectives.objective_text: Identify different sounds in words.
Recall that letters stand for sounds.
Identify rhyming patterns.
Analyze the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA) basics.
Identify a root word (Help in Helper).
Name a prefix (Re-do).
Identify a root family (Act, Actor, Action).
Identify polite words.
Name sarcasm (saying one thing, meaning another).
Identify formal vs. informal speech.
Identify synonyms (Big/Large).
Name opposites (Hot/Cold).
Identify words with similar meanings but different feelings (Skinny vs. Slim).
Identify that people speak differently in different places.
Name 'Y'all' or 'Guys'.
Identify jargon (special words for a job/hobby).
Clap syllables.
Make animal sounds from other countries.
Summarize how the mouth makes sounds (lips vs. throat).
Explain that some languages have clicks or tones.
Explain phonemes (smallest unit of sound).
Defend the importance of precise pronunciation.
Recall that word parts have meaning.
Recall taking turns.
Observe tone of voice.
Recall that one word can mean two things (Bat/Bat).
Observe context clues.
Recall that we speak differently at church vs. the playground.
Observe accents.
Compare a 'B' sound with a 'P' sound (voiced/unvoiced).
Interpret stress patterns (emphasis).
Connect accent to geography.
Add 's' to make it plural.
Summarize how suffixes change a word (Run -> Runner).
Explain compound words (Doghouse).
Break a big word into small parts.
Explain agglutination (gluing words together).
Defend the logic of irregular forms (historical baggage).
Summarize 'Reading between the lines'.
Explain implied meaning ('It's cold in here' = 'Close the window').
Explain deixis (words like 'here' or 'now' that depend on context).
Defend the role of shared knowledge in communication.
Summarize literal vs. figurative meaning.
Explain a metaphor ('He is a lion').
Explain polysemy (multiple meanings).
Defend the importance of precise definition in debate.
Summarize what a Dialect is.
Explain 'Slang' (words kids use).
Explain the evolution of language over time.
Defend the validity of non-standard dialects (descriptive linguistics).
Evaluate the difficulty of reproducing non-native sounds.
Interpret morphemes (meaning units).
Connect Latin roots to English scientific terms.
Compare talking to a baby vs. a teacher.
Analyze speech acts (promising, commanding, apologizing).
Interpret the Gricean maxims (be relevant, be clear).
Connect cultural context to politeness.
Compare dictionary definitions.
Analyze connotation vs. denotation.
Interpret semantic fields (words related to cooking).
Connect ambiguity to humor/puns.
Compare formal writing with texting.
Analyze code-switching (changing speech based on audience).
Interpret the prestige of standard dialects.
Connect language to identity.
Construct a phonetic transcription of a phrase.
Synthesize articulatory phonetics.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Syntax (sentence structure across languages, deep structure)
objectives.objective_text: Identify a complete sentence.

objectives.objective_text: Name the action word.

objectives.objective_text: Identify a fragment.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Syntax (sentence structure across languages, deep structure)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that 'Cat chases dog' is different from 'Dog chases cat'.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Syntax (sentence structure across languages, deep structure)
objectives.objective_text: Diagram a simple sentence.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Syntax (sentence structure across languages, deep structure)
objectives.objective_text: Put words in order.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Syntax (sentence structure across languages, deep structure)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize Subject-Verb-Object.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Syntax (sentence structure across languages, deep structure)
objectives.objective_text: Explain that some languages put the verb last.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Syntax (sentence structure across languages, deep structure)
objectives.objective_text: Explain the difference between surface structure and deep meaning.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Syntax (sentence structure across languages, deep structure)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the generative capacity of human language (Chomsky).
Analyze the difference between inflection (grammar change) and derivation (new word).
Evaluate the productivity of certain affixes.
Evaluate conversational implicature.
Evaluate truth conditions in statements.
Evaluate the social judgments attached to accents.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Syntax (sentence structure across languages, deep structure)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze sentence trees.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Syntax (sentence structure across languages, deep structure)
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the function of conjunctions.
Construct new words using morphological rules.
Synthesize etymological research.
Construct a pragmatic analysis of a dialogue.
Synthesize sociolinguistic competence.
Construct a semantic map of a concept.
Synthesize lexical semantics.
Construct a report on a specific dialect.
Synthesize language variation with social factors.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Syntax (sentence structure across languages, deep structure)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the ambiguity of certain structures.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Syntax (sentence structure across languages, deep structure)
objectives.objective_text: Construct syntax trees for complex sentences.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Syntax (sentence structure across languages, deep structure)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize comparative syntax.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Syntax (sentence structure across languages, deep structure)
objectives.objective_text: Connect recursion (sentences inside sentences) to infinite expression.
